title: --preview flag produces INTERNAL ERROR: f-string expression part cannot include a backslash

labels.name: C: preview style
labels.description: Issues with the preview and unstable style. Add the name of the responsible feature in the title.

body:
**Black v23.1a1**

[Playground link](https://black.vercel.app/?version=stable&state=_Td6WFoAAATm1rRGAgAhARYAAAB0L-Wj4ADsAK5dAD2IimZxl1N_WmBpTZyX5zjgLwP-pyIm8_YgoORJOyuCI4dyGZ4Eo2yAlj2yWKy6dU9uLlNMDZT5M_vwLAHomJrsqP0VuqtlmOtCa4uAlWWj7Ljr4x2m5az1KP-ySgL-Wg5653IMmVj5ye6HAeAJj_yGAeE2XZzjHzjn6HsMY4oyoRT6xRv3OeBMxJBHvKMDce1Wq6lwf4buFV5kDRAKhQm6IBBDKsI6s3IZVKQtFwAAAGCHAVtMWPnGAAHKAe0BAABtM5FrscRn-wIAAAAABFla)

## Options

`--line-length=80`
`--safe`
`--preview`

## Input

```python
my_dict = {"foo": "bar"}
s= f'Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry:\'{my_dict["foo"]}\''

```

## Output

```python
INTERNAL ERROR: Black produced invalid code: f-string expression part cannot include a backslash (<unknown>, line 5). Please report a bug on https://github.com/psf/black/issues.  This invalid output might be helpful: /tmp/blk_5qbr6zhy.log

  File "src/black/__init__.py", line 1324, in assert_equivalent
  File "src/black/parsing.py", line 183, in parse_ast
my_dict = {"foo": "bar"}
s = (
    "Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting"
    f" industry:'{my_dict[\"foo\"]}'"
)

```

## Expected
```python
my_dict = {"foo": "bar"}
s = (
    "Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting"
    f" industry:'{my_dict['foo']}'"
)

```
